p:
HRVs fall under the genus Enterovirus (HEVs) in the family Picornaviridae
12 . Their genome occurs as a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA molecule of approximately 7.2 kb flanked by a 5’ untranslated region (UTR) and 3’ poly-A tail. There are three HRV species denoted as HRV-A, HRV-B and HRV-C within which over 168 genetically distinct types have been identified
13 . Identification of these types presently relies on molecular typing methods based on sequence analysis of VP1 or VP4/VP2 proteins encoding regions
12, 14 .
